cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 170 mi ESE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-southwest, forecast to turn west, then west-northwest and approach the central Louisiana coast as a strengthening system
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near Morgan City

weather_observation.under_watch: Tropical Storm Watch and Storm Surge Watch
weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of the Mississippi River to Morgan City, Louisiana
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central U.S. Gulf Coast from the Upper Texas coast to the western Florida Panhandle, highest risk along the Louisiana coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (≥39 mph) possible late Thursday night or Friday with a 37 % cumulative chance; hurricane-force winds possible along the immediate Louisiana coast by Friday night.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–5 ft of inundation possible from the Mouth of the Pearl River to Morgan City, including areas near the Port of South Louisiana.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches likely with isolated amounts up to 18 inches, leading to flash flooding and river rises along the Mississippi River corridor.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Reduced visibility, strong river currents, and potential temporary closure of shipping channels; possible inland river flooding affecting port logistics.
